page.title: 09CHURCH AND CHAPEL IN PORLOCK
page.content: Porlock church was named after St. Dubricius a Welsh saint who features many time in the King Arthur legends. He married and crowned King Arthur. Tradition says that he founded this church in about 800.The church has an unusual spire;it is{truncated}which means it has no point.It was used for a{beacon.}The parish has its own Rector who looks after Stoke Pero and Porlock Weir as well.Weekly services are well attended.There are many social activities such as bellringing,choir and youth club.Most people get a magazine and so keep in touch.Also there is a{Methodist Church with a Minister and lay preachers. There are 25 members of the Methodist Church.Services for{Roman Catholics are held each Sunday in the village hall.
